content: Hello folks! I'm Ethan (my handle is ethanhs, pronouns he/him/his). I am a university student interested in programming languages and their implementations. I am a member of the core team for mypy, a static type checker for Python and I really like a lot about Rust. I've recently been using Rust to speed up a quantum compiler at work. I'm interested in learning more about mir-opts and I am looking forward to getting more familiar with the internals of the compiler :)
Hi @Ethan Smith! You may want to read the rustc dev guide. Also have you seen the #t-compiler/wg-mir-opt channel?

bjorn3 said:

Hi Ethan Smith! You may want to read the rustc dev guide. Also have you seen the #t-compiler/wg-mir-opt channel?

Hey Bjorn! I've started looking through the rustc dev guide, I think I am going to work on understanding the compiler pipeline first, but then I will probably start looking at mir-opts. Thanks for pointing me in the right direction!
